definition: public cleanliness/(urban) sanitation/environmental sanitation/abbr. for 環境衛生|环境卫生[huan2 jing4 wei4 sheng1]
ring/hoop/loop/(chain) link/classifier for scores in archery etc/to surround/to encircle/to hem in
surname Huan
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sanitation worker

sentences.english: Yesterday, the City Federation of Trade Unions held in sympathy with the Urban Management Committee of the sanitation workers activities.

sentences.english: At last, a kind of strategy that add geography information to the system was introduced.

sentences.english: It also raised the supernumerary City sanitation workers the basic wage.

sentences.english: Provision of clean water and sanitation facilities in schools.
sentences.chinese: 在學校裏提供清潔水和環衛設施。

sentences.english: Methods The medical examination to the dust men was carried out.

sentences.english: Strengthen responsibility , strengthen environmental sanitation of the resident of a city consciousness.

sentences.english: Normal maintenance can significantly improve the service life of the sanitation sprinkles.

sentences.english: The sanitation officers are worrying about aggravating the sweepers' burden.
